newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian airlines lift overseas market share.
newsitem.headline: Australian airlines lift overseas market share.

text.p: Australian Transport Minister John Sharp said on Friday Australian airlines significantly lifted their share of international travel to and from Australia in calendar 1996.
Sharp said Australian carriers improved their share of the market by nearly four percentage points over the past four years to 42.6 percent in 1996 from 38.8 percent in 1992.

"Importantly, this improvement in the market share held by Australian carriers, and its consequential benefits for employment growth and Australia's balance of payments, occurred in a strongly growing market," he said in a statement.
Transport Department figures showed outbound passenger traffic and total passenger traffic hit record highs of 665,100 and 1.29 million respectively in December 1996, he said.
Australia's two main carriers are Qantas Airways Ltd and Ansett Airlines, which is equally owned by News Corp Ltd and Air New Zealand Ltd.
